content: श्यामा {@--1@} Night, particularly a dark night; श्मामां श्यामलिमानमानयत भोः सांद्रैर्मषीकूर्चकैः <ls>Vb. 3. 1.</ls> {@--2@} Shade, shadow. {@--3@} A dark woman. {@--4@} A kind of woman (यौवनमध्यस्था according to <ls>Malli.</ls> on <ls>N. 3. 8</ls>, <ls>Śi. 8. 36</ls>; <ls>Me. 82</ls>; or शीते सुखोष्णसर्वांगी ग्रीष्मे या सुखशीतला . तप्तकांचनवर्णाभा सा स्री श्यामोति कथ्यते according to one commentator on <ls>Bk. 5. 18</ls> and <ls n="Bk.">8. 100</ls>). {@--5@} A woman who has borne no children. {@--6@} A cow. {@--7@} Turmeric. {@--8@} The female cuckoo. {@--9@} The Priyaṅgu creeper; <ls>M. 2. 7</ls>; <ls>Me. 104.</ls> {@--10@} The indigo plant. {@--11@} The holy basil. {@--12@} The seed of the lotus. {@--13@} <ab>N.</ab> of the Yamunā. {@--14@} <ab>N.</ab> of several plants.
